action.action-desc: Mr. Lynch (for himself, Mr. Fitzpatrick, Mr. Rogers of Kentucky, Mr. Rahall, Mr. Keating, Mr. Wolf, and Ms. Slaughter) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Energy and Commerce

form.official-title: To direct the Commissioner of Food and Drugs to modify the approval of any drug containing controlled-release oxycodone hydrochloride to limit such approval to use for the relief of severe-only instead of moderate-to-severe pain, and for other purposes.

section.text:
This Act may be cited as the
Stop Oxy Abuse Act of 2013 .

section.header: Limiting approval of drugs containing controlled-release oxycodone hydrochloride to use for relief of severe-only pain

subsection.text: Not later than 90 days after the date of the enactment of this Act, the Commissioner of Food and Drugs shall take such actions as may be necessaryâ€”

paragraph.text: to modify the approval of any drug containing controlled-release oxycodone hydrochloride under section 505 of the Federal Food, Drug, and Cosmetic Act (21 U.S.C. 355) to limit such approval to use for the relief of severe-only instead of moderate-to-severe pain; and
to limit any subsequent approval of a drug containing controlled-release oxycodone hydrochloride under such section to use for the relief of severe-only pain.

subsection.text: Any modification required by subsection (a)(1) shall apply to drugs introduced or delivered for introduction into interstate commerce on or after the date that is 180 days after the date of the enactment of this Act.
